children.text: The damp-proof course/cavity flashing has a missing section.
Part 3.3.5.8 Damp-proof courses and flashings - installation of the NCC’s Building Code of Australia (BCA) requires that
‘Damp-proof courses and flashings must be located so as to form a continuous damp-proofing barrier around the bottom perimeter of walls where constructed on a concrete slab’ .
Additionally, Australian Standard AS 4773 Masonry for Small Buildings states in clause 9.6.1 Damp-proof courses that
‘Where lap joints in a DPC occur, they shall be not less than 150mm in a straight run, and the width of the DPC at corners’ .
This DPC flashing will need to be properly rectified to form a continuous damp-proof barrier, with care to ensure a minimum 150mm lap at the new joints.
